resources.string:
1. Imbibe---
(a) to learn, 
(b) to rise,
(c) to drink,
(d) to acquire

 2. Stagflation--- 
(a) Controlled prices,
(b) Economic slowdown,
(c) A disintegrated government,
 (d) Cultural dullness.

 3. Scuttle---
(a) Abandon, 
(b) Beweak,
(c) Pile up,
(d) Gossip.

 4. Stanch---(a) To reinforce,
(b) Rotten,
(c) Smooth out
(d) Put an end to.

 5. Choose the correct sentence:
(a) He raced quickly down the street.
(b) He raced down the street.
(c) He raced down quickly to the street.
(d) He raced down fast to the street.

 6. Which of the following is a correct sentence:
(a) He earns hundred taka a day.
 (b) He earns a hundred taka a day.
(c) He earns one hundred taka a day.

 7.The queen is said ___ Australia next year.
 (a) to have visited,
(b) to visit,
(c) to be visiting,
(d) that she will visit.

 8. Ephemeral : Eternal ---
(a) Dexterous : Skillful
(b) Sinister : Threatening
(c) Vicarious : Actual
(d) Clandestine : Hidden

 9. Credulous : Skeptical ---
(a) placate : irritate
(b) cogent : brilliant
(c) proscale :prohibit

 10. Into the ___ of death rode the six hundred.
(a) road,
(b) tunnel,
(c) valley,
(d) city.

খুব সহজে Noun, Adjective, Verb and Adverb
 চেনার উপায়
 Noun : শব্দের শেষে নিম্নলিখিত Suffix 
 গুলো থেকে Noun চেনা যায়:→ 
 (-tion, -ment, -ness, -hood, -dom, -ship, -th, -ity, 
 -gy, -phy, -my, -ure, -cy, -tude, -mony, -nce, - 
 age, -er, -or, -sion, -ist, -ee, -ism). 
 Adjective : শব্দের শেষে নিম্নলিখিত 
 Suffix গুলো থেকে Adjective চেনা যায়:→ 
 (-ble, -ish, -less, -ary, -ive, -ful, -ar, -al, -ate, -ic, 
 -sque, -id, -ile, -ry, -line, -ous/ose, -lent, -an). 
 
 Verb : শব্দের শেষে নিম্নলিখিত Suffix 
 গুলো থেকে Verb চেনা যায়:→ 
 (-ate, -en, -fy, -esce, -ise, -ize, -ish). 
 
 Adverb : শব্দের শেষে নিম্নলিখিত Suffix 
 গুলো থেকে Adverb চেনা যায়:→ 
 (-wise, -ways, -ly, -ward)

1.Die of (কোন রোগে মারা যাওয়া) He died of cholera.
 2. Die from (কোন কারণে মারা যাওয়া) He died from overeating.
 3. Die by (আকষ্মিক বা ইচ্ছাকৃত ভাবে মারা যাওয়া) He died by suicide.
 4. Die for (আত্নত্যগ করা) We are ready to die for our country.
 5.Die out(বিলীন হওয়া ) Morality is dying out gradually.
 6.Die away(দুর্বল হওয়া) The man died away for hunger.
 7. Made in (দেশের দ্বারা তৈরি) This mobile is made in China.
 8. Made by (কোন কোম্পানির দারা তৈরি) This mobile is made by NOKIA.
 9. Made of (কোন উপাদান দ্বারা তৈরি) This box is made of plastic
 10. Consist of (গঠিত) The committee consists of ten members.
 11. Consist in (নিহিত) True happiness consists in contentment.
 12.Deal in(ব্যবসা করা) I deal in rice.
 13.Deal with(ব্যবহার করা ) You should deal with cordially.

1. Abate-soothe,relieve,mitigate,reduce,subside.
 3.Abortive-Unsuccessful,Bungled
. 3. Adequate:Competent,passable,sufficient.
 4. Fertile:Effective,fructuous,prolific,productive,fruitful,pregnant.
 5. Generate: produce,make,create,build,induce.
 6. Hostile:Adverse,ambivalent,repugnant,enemy,rival,competing.
 7. Illusive: Imaginary,fictive,mythical,enchanted,spurious,deceitful.
 8. Interrupt: Isolate,interfere,separate,differ.
 9. Malice-spite,rancor,malevolence.

1. Debase: elevate,enhance, improve.
 2. Autocrat: Democrat,communist.
 3. Innovate: Destroy,end,finish,ignore,stop.
 4. Lucid: Ambiguous,obscure,vague.
 5. Magnify:Reduce,Belittle,diminish.
 6. Pensive-Negligent,Uncaring,ignorant,shallow.
 7. Repeal: Enact,approval,arrange,support,ratify.

1. The father of modern English poetry – GeoffreyChaucer
 2. Shakespeare is known mostly for his- Play
 3. The English “Epic Poet”- John Milton
 4. The first English dictionary writer- Samuel Johnson
 5. The most famous satirist in English literature -Jonathan Swift
 6. The father of English novel – Henry Fielding
 7. The poet of nature – William Wordsworth
 8. Both poet and painter- William Blake
 9. Poet of Sensuousness – John Keats
 11. The poet of beauty – John Keats
 12.The Rebel poet in English literature – Lord Byron
 13. The greatest modern English dramatist – G.B.Shaw
 14.The father of modern English literature – G.B.Shaw
 15. The first English novel – Pamela
 16. The first translator of the Bible into English – John Wycliff
 17. The poet of poets – Edmund Spenser.
